content.question: An athlete is planning for the “Land and Lake Race,” the path of which is shown in the figure above. The contestants will start at the dot, run up to 4 miles along the beach, enter the water at any time, and swim to the island. The athlete estimates that they can run along the beach at a constant rate of 8 miles per hour and swim at a constant rate of 2 miles per hour. Let <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></math> be a function that represents the time to complete the race, where <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the distance in miles that the athlete runs and <math alttext="T of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in hours. Which of the following methods best explains how to determine the minimum time, in hours, the athlete should run along the beach and then swim to the island?

choices.label: Let <math alttext="T of x, equal, 8 x, plus 2 times the square root of 1 squared, plus, open parenthesis, 4 minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve <math alttext="T prime of x, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> and find the values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="T prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> changes sign from negative to positive. Evaluate <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></math> for those values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the minimum time.

Let <math alttext="T of x, equal, the fraction x over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator the square root of 1 squared, plus, open parenthesis, 4 minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end root, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo></mrow></mstyle><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve <math alttext="T prime of x, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and find the values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="T prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> changes sign from negative to positive. Evaluate <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></math> for those values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the minimum time.

Let <math alttext="T of x, equal, the fraction x over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator the square root of 1 squared, plus x squared, end root, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo></mrow></mstyle><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve <math alttext="T prime of x, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and find the values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="T prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> changes sign from negative to positive. Evaluate <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></math> for those values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the minimum time.

Let <math alttext="T of x, equal, the fraction x over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator the square root of, open parenthesis, 4 minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end root, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo></mrow></mstyle><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve <math alttext="T prime of x, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and find the values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="T prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> changes sign from negative to positive. Evaluate <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></math> for those values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the minimum time.

content.answer: Let <math alttext="T of x, equal, the fraction x over 8, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator the square root of 1 squared, plus, open parenthesis, 4 minus x, close parenthesis, squared, end root, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>T</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo></mrow></mstyle><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Solve <math alttext="T prime of x, equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and find the values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="T prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> changes sign from negative to positive. Evaluate <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></math> for those values of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to determine the minimum time.

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
